title: [$250] Add report columns

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from [this issue](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/71821), we want to add specific columns to `type:expense-report`, as follows: Displaying type:expense-report results Add default report column headers: - Created - Status - Title - From - To - Total - Action Default sort column: - “Created” (newest > oldest) - Allow all columns to be clicked to sort.

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** **Reproducible in production?:** **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @cead22 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1761674838742469) ## Action Performed: Issue Summary: The UpdateWorkspaceMembersRole command is being called with an empty employees array ([]). While the exact reproduction steps are unclear, logs confirm it is occurring in production. ## Expected Result: UpdateWorkspaceMembersRole should not be called with an empty employees array. The request should be blocked, ignored, or validated client-side before being sent. ## Actual Result: The command is sometimes executed with: employees: [] Affected app versions: 9.2.38-0 [(Logs)](https://www.expensify.com/_devportal/tools/logSearch/#query=request_id%3A%22993b6b8bfa819a6e-LAX%22&engine=elasticsearch) 9.2.33-4[ (Logs)](https://www.expensify.com/_devportal/tools/logSearch/#query=request_id:(%2299192353d96ed6d5-LAX%22)&index=_all&engine=elasticsearch) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.39-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Unable to validate in Prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176668/test-cases/41236630, https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176668/test-cases/41236632 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.6.1 Chrome **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: Preconditions: Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com in incognito window. Set the cookies: lc-debug = 1; lc-qa = 2, refresh the page 1. Sign up with a new user, use gmail address without a + 2. On the onboarding select "Manage my team's expenses" - 1-10, any accounting software 3. Verify there's a last modal to ask the user "How would you like to get started" with the options "Take a test drive" and "Explore all features" ## Expected Result: "How would you like to get started" modal is displayed at the end of the onboarding flow ## Actual Result: "How would you like to get started" modal is not displayed at the end of the onboarding flow, only "Take a test drive" modal ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c723aeab-7a31-479f-87a0-9c244414b1ea [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.39-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjionsdjosijnsodi@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create a group chat with two users. 3. Click + > Split expense > Manual. 4. Create a split manual expense. 5. Click on the split preview. 6. Click outside RHP to close it. 7. Click + > Split expense > Manual. 8. Enter amount > Next. 9. Click < arrow button on confirm page. ## Expected Result: There should be no arrow buttons on confirm page because there is only one split manual expense. ## Actual Result: There are arrow buttons on confirm page when there is only one split manual expense. The first split shows split with self with 0.00 amount. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/820633d3-17f7-4b9d-ba9f-6b587ccfad2e [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Expense -Expense changed to workspace with workflows disabled can be paid from "Reports"

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.39-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1525/folder/13176670/52235731/976866637 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1969@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least two workspaces. Prerequisite 2: First workspace has delayed submissions and approvals enabled and second workspace has workflows disabled. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open workspace chat with workflows enabled. 3. Create a manual expense. 4. Open the just created expense and tap on "Submit" 5. Tap on "More" and select "Change Workspace" 6. Select workspace with workflows disabled to change the expense to. 7. Navigate to the workspace where expense was changed. 8. Note that expense preview shows a "View" button. 9, Open expense report. 10. Note that expense remains with "Outstanding" status instead of "Done" and that next step show "Waiting for you to pay expense" despite user being unable to pay it from report. 11. Navigate to "Reports" > "Reports" 12. Note that expense preview shows a "Pay" button. 13. Pay expense. 14. Open report and tap on "More" 15. Note that there is no "Cancel Payment" option. ## Expected Result: When an expense that is pending approval is moved to a workspace with workflows disabled, status should change to "Done" and next step message should be "No further action requires" as user shouldn´t be able to pay it. ## Actual Result: When an expense that is pending approval is moved to a workspace with workflows disabled, status remains as "Outstanding" instead of "Done", and next step message displays "Waiting for you to pay expense". Expense report only shows a "View" button on chat, but can still be paid from "Reports" section on "Reports". After paying the expense, no "Cancel Payment" option is available. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aedd7a75-7587-4727-897c-3712b63f1297 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.39-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exp https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1524/folder/13176741/41237124/976865154 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjnsoidjosidjs1@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Admin invites member to workspace. - Member has submitted an expense in the workspace chat. - Perform the steps below as admin. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to Account > Troubleshoot > Clear cache and restart > Reset and refresh. 3. Go to Inbox. 4. Open workspace chat with member. 5. Click on the expense preview. BUG 1: Expense fields become read-only. 6. Click on the header subtitle to return to main workspace chat. 7. Click on the expense preview. → Expense fields are editable when opened for the second time. 8. Click on the header subtitle to return to main workspace chat. 9. Click on the expense preview. BUG 2: Transaction thread report with RBR appears on LHN, and it is grayed out with no composer. There is no way to dismiss it. ## Expected Result: BUG 1: Expense fields will be editable when opened for the first time. BUG 2: No grayed out report with RBR will appear on LHN. ## Actual Result: BUG 1: Expense fields become read-only when opened for the first time. The fields only become editable after reopening the expense report (Step 7). BUG 2: Transaction thread report with RBR appears on LHN, and it is grayed out with no composer. There is no way to dismiss it. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e23976c-b099-4335-ab40-ae03ae4bc01e [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.38-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72086 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+2010021kh@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Log in with Expensifail account. 1.
